titleStmt.title: Elijah F. Nuttall et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10935

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency B MaGoffin Governor of Kentucky Your Petitioners would respectfully represent that at the October May Term of the Grant Circuit Court 1861. one Patrick Bannen was fined fifty Dollars for carrying concealed weapons: we think the assessment of sd fine a great hardship upon Mr. Bannan He is a very quiet and Gentlemanly citizens, Sober. & discreet. it is the first ioffence of which he has even been charged in our county It will meet the universal approbation of the citizen of Grant should your Excellency remit so much of said fine as lies in your power to do. Oct 29th 1861.

E F Nuttall
J. H. Webb
O. D. McManama
W Smith Clk G c ct
J. O'Hara Jr
M Burnett
J. M. Callin
W. T. Simmons
T. M. Coombs
Squire Lucas s g c
E H Smith
O. P. Hogan
J. W. Collins
Robt H O'Hara
John A Turner
P. U. Major Com'th Atty
A Kendall

Grant Cir. Ct
Remitted
B. M.
